page.title: 19TOURISM
page.content: {Tourists}staying in Apperley choose it because of its closeness to the M5 & M50 motorways,its tranquil rural setting and its proximity to more famous centres of interest. The nearest site is{Tewkesbury}with its Abbey, Elizabethan and Georgian buildings and the River Avon. {Cheltenham,}the Regency Spa Town with its quality shopping is ten miles away with internationally famous music and literary festivals.{Gloucester's Cathedral attracts millions of tourists every year, partly to the Triennial "Three Choirs Festival". Many people are, however, drawn to {Deerhurst and Apperley}by the Saxon Deerhurst Church. Apperley has its own Guest House owned by the Sabins and approved by the English Tourist Board. Dinner, bed and breakfast costs Â£10.50p per night in 1985.
